workflow-instructions.name: mothership-alignment
workflow-instructions.overview: Identify and document all mothership assets the venture can leverage. Run the "Asset Jam" — a structured exercise to surface IP, technology, data, customer relationships, brand, and talent that give the venture unfair competitive advantages. Then align the Sponsor on venture direction and support needs.

step.name: asset-jam-intro
step.title: Asset Jam — Frame the Exercise
step.instructions: Introduce the Asset Jam: "We are going to systematically identify every mothership capability this venture can leverage. Be exhaustive — even assets that seem tangential can be powerful unfair advantages. We'll cover: IP, technology, data, customer relationships, brand, distribution, talent, regulatory access, and financial resources." Ask user: Who should be in the room for this exercise? (Venture team + any mothership experts)

step.name: ip-technology
step.title: IP and Technology Assets
step.instructions: Identify all IP and technology assets: 1. Patents relevant to the venture domain 2. Proprietary algorithms, models, or data processing capabilities 3. Internal software that could be productized or adapted 4. Research and development outputs not yet commercialized 5. Trademarks and brand assets in the domain For each asset: describe it, assess relevance to venture, identify access level, name the internal owner/contact.

step.name: customer-data
step.title: Customer, Data, and Distribution Assets
step.instructions: Identify customer and market access: 1. Existing customer base — are any in the venture's ICP? Can we interview/pilot with them? 2. Key customer relationships — who has deep relationships with target customers? 3. Distribution channels — sales teams, partner networks, digital channels 4. Proprietary data sets relevant to the problem we're solving 5. Market intelligence or industry reports only the mothership has access to

step.name: brand-talent
step.title: Brand, Reputation, and Human Capital
step.instructions: Assess softer but critical assets: 1. Brand recognition in the domain — does the mothership name open doors? 2. Industry credibility and trust signals 3. Regulatory licenses or certifications the venture can leverage 4. Internal domain experts who can advise the venture 5. Executive relationships in the target customer ecosystem

step.name: asset-map-output
step.title: Produce Mothership Asset Map
step.instructions: Compile all assets into the Mothership Asset Map using the mothership-asset-map.md template. Prioritize: identify Top 3 Unfair Advantages. List assets to activate in next 30 days. Save to output folder. Update venture-state.yaml.

step.name: sponsor-alignment
step.title: Sponsor Alignment
step.instructions: Document and structure the Sponsor alignment: 1. What does the Sponsor need to understand about the venture challenge? 2. What resources has the Sponsor committed (budget, time, relationships)? 3. What are the Sponsor's key concerns or red lines? 4. How will the team keep the Sponsor informed? (cadence, format) 5. What decisions require Sponsor approval? Add Sponsor details to mothership-asset-map.md (Sponsor Alignment section). Update venture-state.yaml: category_progress.mothership = "complete".
step.state-update: Update: completed_artifacts, category_progress.mothership, guiding_questions.setup answers for mothership questions
